function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Losing interest in news about covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreasing/diminished interest and avoidance of news about covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pandemic fatigue leading to desensitization and avoidance of news about the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Avoidance and denial of covid-19-related information leading to reduced compliance with public health measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Younger individuals losing interest in covid-19 news","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Greater post-traumatic stress symptoms associated with decreasing interest in covid-19 news","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Prolonged exposure to negative news about covid-19 causing desensitization","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreasing burden of negative information about covid-19 in media may decrease stress but also public interest in covid-19 news.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Greater utilization of secondary interpersonal information sources like friends and relatives may increase the risk of covid-19 fatigue and decrease interest in pandemic news.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased reliance on healthcare professionals for covid-19 information may lead to greater trust in the information but could result in decreased public interest in pandemic news.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Selection bias in online survey due to majority of respondents being women and aged 40 years.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Younger age implicated as a risk factor for non-adherence to public/social pandemic control measures.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreasing interest and avoidance of news about covid-19 associated with specific demographic and psychological factors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of far-uvc light in occupied public settings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to aerosolized h1n1 influenza virus through far-uvc light testing","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inactivation of human coronaviruses with far-uvc light","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to contagious coronaviruses in aerosols","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of viral integration in human lung host cells","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to aerosolized viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transmission potential of coronaviruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of biological damage from uv light","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious disease sensitivity to uv light","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in virus survival assays","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Similar uv sensitivity across coronaviruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to 222 nm far-uvc light in public places","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous far-uvc exposure at regulatory limits","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to far-uvc light","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate regulatory dose limits","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Propagation of viral strains in human cell lines.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Generation and exposure of viral aerosols in an aerosol irradiation chamber.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to aerosolized viruses in the uv exposure chamber","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection of the uv exposure chamber","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient dosimetry of the uv exposure chamber","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to high-intensity uv radiation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased transmission of uv radiation through plastic windows","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aerosol particle exposure to high uv dose","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to aerosolized virus particles during the experimental protocol","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling virus infectivity assays without proper safety protocols","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to virus during the experiment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of laboratory surfaces and equipment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorrect calculation of tcid 50 and pfu/ml","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Working in a laboratory setting with human cells and viruses poses a risk of accidental exposure and transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to contagious viruses during experimental studies on virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient data and small sample sizes leading to unreliable estimates of virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential flaws in statistical analyses and modeling of virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through wearable technology","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on wearable technology for health monitoring","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Privacy and security risks with wearable technology data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wearables to detect covid-19 symptoms may lead to false positives or false negatives, resulting in incorrect diagnoses.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on wearables for early detection of infection may lead to privacy concerns, as biometric data and gps information are utilized for tracking and alerting individuals.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
